did.abstract: District judge from Warren, Michigan. Correspondence, campaign materials, and other papers concerning his work as delegate to Michigan Constitutional Convention, 1961-1962, as Warren city councilman, and as attorney and judge; papers concerning local and state Democratic politics, and his activities with Polish-American organizations and his interest in Polish American history and personages. Also includes digital images.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Judge Don Binkowski (donor no. 5501) and came to the library in 1974. Periodic additions have been received.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research, except for the diaries in boxes 10 and 11 which are closed until 2048.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Don Binkowski papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Don Binkowski was born October 26, 1929 in Detroit, Michigan. He received his B.A. from the University of Michigan in 1951 and his LL.B. from Wayne State University in 1956. Following graduation, he worked for the Allstate Insurance Company as a casualty examiner (1956-1957), as assistant attorney general (1957-1959), as department officer in the office of the Michigan Department of State (1959-1960), with the Wayne County Friend of Court (1960-1961), as a delegate to the Michigan Constitutional Convention (1961-1962), and as a member of the Michigan Labor Mediation Board (1962-1963).
In addition to private practice in the city of Warren, Binkowski has served on the Warren City Council, (mayor pro tem 1965-1968) and as Judge of the 37th District Court in Warren (1969-1986).
Proud of his Polish heritage, Binkowski has been both a historian and a collector of historical materials relating to the contribution of Polish-Americans.

arrangement.p: The Don Binkowski papers have been arranged into the following series: Biographical/Personal files; Constitutional Convention; Offices Held; Polish-American files; Political Activities and Elections; Visual Materials; and Schedule Book and Diaries.

scopecontent.p: The Don Binkowski collection consists of correspondence, campaign materials, and other papers concerning his work as delegate to Michigan Constitutional Convention, 1961-1962, as Warren city councilman, and as attorney and judge; also papers concerning local and state Democratic politics, and his activities with Polish-American organizations.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Busing for school integration--Michigan.
Judges--Michigan--Warren.
controlaccess.corpname: Michigan Federation, Citizens for Education Freedom.
controlaccess.subject: Polish Americans--Michigan.

scopecontent.p: The Biographical/Personal files (3 linear feet) contain biographical information about Binkowski, including photographs and a photo CD, genealogical research, and correspondence with family, judges, and politicians. Digital content includes image files of a 2006 event and various historical and Polish American figures.

did.unittitle: "Tolerated But Never Accepted: Polish American Officials of Michigan and Polonia in a World Political Perspective"

odd.p: (include photographs, mostly contain correspondence about book, which is authored by Binkowski, as well as copies of images used in it, but not book itself)
(contains materials relating to book, such as correspondence, but not book itself)

scopecontent.p: The Constitutional Convention files (1 linear foot) includes correspondence, reports, materials received as a delegates, some of the statements made by him to the Convention, and materials related to delegate reunions.

The series (4 linear feet) is organized into three subseries: Assistant Attorney General, Judge, Michigan 37th District Court, and Warren City Council. Files include complaints filed by and against Judge Binkowski, correspondence, administrative issues, and Warren City Council minutes.

did.unittitle: Character Witness, Statements of and requests for 1982-1984
Law firms other than Philip Green 1969-1983
Related to Marrocco, W. Thomas, Warren City Attorney 1981-1983
Press and radio/TV treatment of complaints against Binkowski before Judicial Tenure Commission 1981-1984
Mayor Shaw vs. Binkowski -- Civil Law Suit 1966

scopecontent.p: The Polish-American files (1.5 linear feet) relates to local and national Polish clubs and organizations with which Binkowski was involved.

did.unittitle: Parisville, Michigan historical Marker (1st Polish settlement in Michigan) 1969-1976
Radzialowski, Thaddeus C. -- Polish American Studies Center 1977
Saginaw Valley College Institute of Polish Studies 1977
Wayne State University (Agreement with University of Lodz, Poland) 1977

scopecontent.p: The Political Activities and Elections series (1.5 linear feet) is organized by the following subseries: Binkowski Campaigns, Issue Campaigns, and Political Activities. The Binkowski Campaigns subseries documents Binkowski's various campaigns for office and includes campaign materials, correspondence, and press releases. The Issues Campaigns subseries includes files on issues Binkowski was involved with, including Citizens for Educational Freedom. Political Activities includes correspondence, materials from state and local elections in the 1950s and 1960s in which Binkowski was involved.

did.unittitle: Michigan Democratic State Central Committee Nationalities Division 1962-1963

scopecontent.p: The Visual materials series (0.2 linear feet) includes personal photographs of Binkowski's family and from his political campaigns. Also a VHS relating to a book written by Binkowski "Col. P.W. Norris, Yellowstone's Greatest Superintendent."

did.unittitle: Dedication of the Governor Alex J. Groesbeck historical marker 1975

odd.p: (include photos of Gov. G. Mennen Williams)

scopecontent.p: The Schedule Books and Diaries series (2 linear feet) consists of 40 years of Binkowski's diaries and schedule books. The volumes are closed to researchers until January 1, 2048.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material related to Binkowski's interest in Democratic politics and the Polish American community in Michigan can be found in another collection titled, "Don Binkowski, collected materials."
